name: Data Structures
description: This project represents a comprehensive exploration into core data structures and algorithms. It encompasses the implementation and practical application of fundamental data structures including Linked Lists, Doubly Linked Lists, Hash Maps, and Hash Sets, along with a Binary Tree. Additionally, the project delves into algorithmic techniques, featuring implementations of Binary Search and Bubble Sort. Each component was created to deepen my understanding of computer science principles, showcasing my ability to both grasp and apply complex concepts in a real-world context.

name: Collection of CLI apps
description:
In the early stages of my programming journey, I embarked on creating a suite of command-line interface (CLI) applications, focusing on interactive games and challenges. This collection features classic games such as Black Jack, Higher-Lower, Rock Paper Scissors, Hangman, and more, each designed to provide a fun and engaging way to interact with the fundamentals of coding.

Among these projects is my first attempt at solving the Knight's Tour puzzle, tackled just two weeks into learning programming. This endeavor, although not optimized for efficiency, represents a significant milestone in my coding journey, showcasing my early enthusiasm and willingness to tackle complex problems head-on. While it remains a work in progress, it symbolizes the beginning of my deep dive into the world of algorithms and data structures, setting the foundation for my continuous learning and development in software engineering.

name: Pokemon Game
tagline: A terminal pokemon game for 2 players
description: A fun pokemon game, you can find instructions how to install and how to play in the repo readme. Some of the rules are missing, I will rewrite them at some point.

name: Advent of Code
description: During the bootcamp, I managed to complete all the challenges provided ahead of time, so the mentors tasked me with doing advent of code. This is the repo of the AC challenges I did during the bootcamp.

name: Portfolio Backend
description:
A portfolio project I created to easily update project links without the need to revise my entire CV. As I'm still relatively new to deployment and CI/CD pipelines, this approach allows for flexibility and efficiency in managing project references.

To enhance the manageability of my portfolio project, I implemented a dedicated admin panel, designed to streamline the process of updating and managing project references and personal information.

To ensure my seed data remains up to date, I've set up a Node.js project with two scripts: one for seeding the production database and another for extracting the latest data.

name: Recipe GitHub Frontend
tagline: Frontend of the Recipe GitHub project
description: The frontend of this project complements the backend, offering a user-friendly interface for Recipe GitHub. While my primary focus was on setting up CICD and the AWS server, I also provided occasional support to colleagues facing challenges. Continuous communication was essential to ensure seamless integration between frontend and backend components.

name: Recipe GitHub Backend
tagline: Group project, reference Actions and Commits to get the full picture
description: A Recipe website but with a twist, users are not only able to create their recipes,they can also Fork(copy) other users recipes and make their own version of it. There is support for 1-5 star reviews, comments, search, featured recipes using the TSVECTOR table for the search, likes/dislikes on comments and much more.

name: Simple Recipe App Backend
description: I created the Simple Recipe App as a learning exercise mostly by following a tutorial. This project allowed me to gain hands-on experience with Python, Django, PostgreSQL, Docker, Github Actions, and AWS deployment. While the initial implementation was based on the tutorial, I also took the opportunity to customize and extend the project to further enhance my understanding of these technologies.

name: NC-News Backend
description: NC-News Backend is a Reddit-like news site where I leveraged technologies beyond my bootcamp curriculum. I not only completed core tasks promptly but also implemented features such as authentication, CICD pipeline, AWS deployment, Docker containerization, TypeScript migration, interactive Swagger documentation, and more.

name: NC-News Frontend
description: The NC-News Frontend complements the backend, providing a functional user interface for the NC-News project. My primary goal was to gain a deep understanding of frontend-backend integration rather than focusing on aesthetics. While it may not be the most visually appealing, it serves as a valuable learning experience for improving my backend development skills.

name: Construction Management Tool
description:
As the tagline says, currently work in progress, it's what I lacked in my job as an assistant manager, this one is going a bit slower than the rest of my projects. I plan to have microservices for the main site, auth and the management tool, services will be on the same host so I won't get the full benefit but I'm doing it mainly for practice. Tests for this one are also done inside containers and using compose for the test database container.

The site will allow for staff management, expenses and profit management, projects will be added to the main site once marked as completed, I plan for invoice generation and sending it as a pdf to a given email.

As of right now I'm still mostly planning and building the basic features of the main site.

name: Leet Code with C#
tagline: Leet Code, Advent of Code, Some data structures
description: dotNetEverything, a comprehensive repository where I explore and solve various programming challenges and concepts using C#. This project serves as a personal journey through different aspects of programming, from data structures and algorithms to solving real-world problems.

name: Leet Code with TypeScript
tagline: A collection of easy and mid leet code problems solved using typescript.
description: As I delved deeper into the world of data structures and algorithms through various courses, I challenged myself with LeetCode problems to apply what I've learned and refine my problem-solving skills. This repository is a testament to that journey, showcasing my solutions and the knowledge I've gained along the way.

name: Portfolio Frontend
description:
The frontend of my portfolio project has a simple and elegant design that helps me display my projects clearly and without unnecessary complexity. I created this space primarily to present my work and make it easy to update when necessary. This way, I can keep my project references current without having to make extensive changes to my CV. 

 The admin panel left accessible on krasen.site/admin on purpose, please feel free to take a walk around it, it requires authentication so you will not be able to make any changes.
